turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: You want a drink?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: This is pretty good. Considering...

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: So you're a waitress, right? I mean...from the uniform you were wearing.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Yup. That's me.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You like it?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: [Beat] I do it.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Have you always been a waitress?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] Why'd you stop?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Shit happens, and your life changes. 'Bout the best explanation of a lot of things that happen. [Beat] So how come you don't know where you're coming from?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't know, but I think part of it's...

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Well, good for you.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] Why?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: [Beat] Real is overrated.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You don't think that's crazy?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Maybe. [Beat] Maybe not.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: This is a great song.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: You remember it?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: But hey, who can forget those words? The man just wants simple and good things for his woman -- that she be warm and happy. How hard can that be to remember?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: May be easy to remember, but not easy to get. Being warm, maybe -- but, look, you don't even have a coat and I still have to chop wood to make a fire. [Beat] And, being happy...you tell me if that's simple.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: They told me I joined the army when I was seventeen. That's when my father died and, before that, it was apparently just me and him since I was born 'cause my mom split.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: So you never knew your mother?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I guess not. But, as of now, I never knew either.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yeah. [Beat] How about you?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Never knew my father. I grew up with my mother. Actually, I grew up around my mother. She was great though. I mean, the way she was with her friends... She was this woman who had so much life in her, she had to find ways to kill some of it just to be like the rest of us. [Beat] She died young.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: She fucked herself up day after day and then, one day, she fell asleep with a burning cigarette. [Beat] I came home from work and she was gone.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Yeah, me too. [Softly] Every day for the last ten years.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: That when you stopped being a nurse?

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: Damnit, Thelma, don't holler like that!  Haven't I told you I can't stand it when you holler in the morning.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Doll, I just didn't want you to be late.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Hon.

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Have a good day at work today.

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Hon?

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You want anything special for dinner?

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: No, Thelma, I don't give a shit what we have for dinner.  I may not even make it home for dinner.  You know how Fridays are.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Funny how so many people wanna buy carpet on a Friday night.  You'd almost think they's want to forget about it for the weekend.

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: Well then, it's a good thing you're not regional manager and I am.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: 'Bye, honey.  I won't wait up.

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: See ya.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: ... only for one day and we'll be back tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: No you won't.  You'll be back today. Now!  You get your ass back here, Thelma, now, Goddamnit.  Thelma, do you understand me?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Darryl.

turns.speaker: DARRYL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Go fuck yourself.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Honey?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Yes, baby?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Do you think you could ever shoot someone?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Do you think you could ever think of a set of circumstances that would just cause you to haul off and shoot someone?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I could shoot your cousin Eddie.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Because he's an inconsiderate asshole.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm asking you seriously, Sarah, a stranger?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I don't know, honey.  I guess it would depend.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: On what?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Well, maybe if they were trying to hurt you or one of the kids.  I'm sure I could shoot someone if they tried to hurt one of the children.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Yeah, I could too.  But... I don't know why I'm even asking you this. It's just... we can't place anybody at the scene but these two gals that everybody swears is sweet as pie. I don't know.  I keep hearing words -- impossible -- inconceivable.  If just one person would say...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Honey.  Nothing's impossible.  You just don't shoot someone like that for no reason.  Maybe he was askin' for it.  Anyway, somebody's husband probably got ol' Harlan.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's what everybody says.  Only problem is nobody's husband was unaccounted for that night... Could you shoot Eddie in the face?  At point blank range?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: In the leg.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I gotta go to Little Rock.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Who's the nut?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's Thelma Dickinson's husband.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Aw, God.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Alright!  She did good!  Didn't she?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Well, son, she's doin' a damn sight better 'n you right now.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: We spoke with a gentlemen today who says he personally delivered very close to that same amount to a Miss Louise Sawyer.  Do you know her too?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Umm, yes.  She was driving.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: He said he took it to a motel in Oklahoma City.  He also says that at that time he met a man.  He identified you through a series of mug shots.  He also told us that you and Mrs. Dickinson seemed "close." Is that true?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: You might say we had a meeting of the minds, yes.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Did either of them ever indicate that they might be running from the Law?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Now that you mention it, they might have been a little bit jumpy.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You know what?  You're starting to irritate me.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: How do you know I took it?  How do you know they didn't just give it to me?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: There's two girls out there that had a chance, they had a chance...!  And you blew it for 'em.  Now they've gotten in some serious trouble, some very serious trouble and for at least part of it, I'm gonna hold you personally responsible for anything that happens to them.  I've got no feelin' for you.  But I may be the only person in the world who gives a rat's ass what happens to them and you're either gonna tell me every damn thing you know, so there's a small chance I can actually do them some good, or I'm gonna be all over you like a fly on shit for the rest of your natural life.  Your misery is gonna be my goddamn mission in life.  That's a sincere promise.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Could you identify 'em, if ya saw 'em again?

turns.speaker: LENA
turns.text: Hal, I've told you about twenty times, yes, I could identify 'em, but neither one of them was the type to pull something like this.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Well, you're not exactly an expert witness, but what makes you so sure?

turns.speaker: LENA
turns.text: If waitin' tables in a bar don't make you an expert on human nature, then nothin' will, and I could've told you that Harlan Puckett would end up buyin' it in a parkin' lot. I'm just surprised it didn't happen before now.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Who do you think did it?

turns.speaker: LENA
turns.text: Has anybody asked his wife?  She's the one I hope did it.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Lena, just cut the bullshit, will ya?  Do have any ideas or don't ya? I been standin' in this stupid parkin' lot all goddamn night, and I still got to go file a report before I can go home in time to get back up again!

turns.speaker: LENA
turns.text: Well, if I had to guess, I'd say it was some ol' gal, some ol' gal's husband.  But it wasn't either one of those two.  The tall one, the redhead, she left me a huge tip.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You didn't happen to notice what kind of car they were driving?

turns.speaker: LENA
turns.text: It's a nightclub, not a drive-in, Hal.  I don't follow the customers to the parking lot.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Alright, Lena.  Go on home.  We might have to call you in for some more questioning.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I've been better.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You girls are in some hot water.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I know.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We're both fine.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Good.  You wanna tell me what happened?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Sure.  Maybe over coffee sometime. I'll buy.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: How are things goin' out there?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Weird.  Got some kind of snowball effect goin' here or somethin'.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You're still with us though.  You're somewhere on the face of the earth?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Well, we're not in the middle of nowhere, but we can see it from here.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You're gettin' in deeper every moment you're gone.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Would you believe me if I told you this whole thing is an accident?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I do believe you.  That's what I want everybody to believe.  Trouble is, it doesn't look like an accident and you're not here to tell me about it... I need you to help me here.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You want to come on in?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You know, certain words and phrases just keep floating through my mind, things like incarceration, cavity search, life imprisonment, death by electrocution, that sort of thing. So, come out alive?  I don't know. Let us think about that.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Louise, I'll do anything.  I know what's makin' you run.  I know what happened to you in Texas.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: All we know is there were two women in a green T-Bird convertible that turned left out of the parking lot, going real fast.  We're trying to get a make on the car, but nothin' yet.  So far, we got nothin'.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Well, you'd best get something. Even if they didn't do it, it times out that they most likely witnessed it.  I want somebody to at least talk to 'em.  Put out an APB with a description and see what we get back.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Is there any reason to believe they've left the state?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's certainly possible.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Why don't we go ahead and let the bureau in on this.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I have no problem with that.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Somebody's butt is gonna bar-b-que.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I swear to God, she wouldn't tell me one thing!  Christ!  You oughta try to find that kid that was with 'em.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Tell us about him.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Just some young guy.  Around twenty years old.  Dark hair.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: This is serious, son.  A man is dead.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I know!  I'd tell you if I knew! Goddamn!  I know something happened, or she wouldn't have left.  I'm trying to remember everything!  Find that fucking kid.  He probably knows something.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Is this the guy you saw them with?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's him.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Armed robber.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Oh, great.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What kind of gun was it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Right.  Where are they?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We're going to leave someone here at the house in the event that she calls in.  Someone will be here until we find them.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: The important thing is not to let on that you know anything.  We want to try and find out where they are. Now I don't want to get too personal, but do you have a good relationship with your wife?  Are you close with her?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Good God.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: My Lord.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Now, for one thing, you violated your parole two days out.  And you know Judge Hainey.  He hates this sort of thing.  Once he gets wind of this, he's gonna blow sky high.  And then when he finds out that you're a possible accessory to murder and armed robbery, well, I think we can safely place your ass back in the slammer for at least the remaining eight, don't you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh, definitely.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's just not working like this.  We gotta do something.  It'd be one thing if these girls were hardened criminals, but Jesus, Hal, this is makin' us look bad.  I don't know... maybe they're not movin'.  Maybe that little creep lied.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: He's got nothin' to gain by lyin'.  Nothin' at all.  He already got all their money.  I just don't know what we're dealin' with here. Anyway, it went out again last night on Nationwide Teletype.  Let's just wait it out a little longer.  She said she was gonna call back.  Let's just sit tight.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We don't have a whole lotta choice, do we?  I can't figure out if they're real smart or just really, really lucky.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: It don't matter.  Brains will only get you so far and luck always runs out.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Hey!  Don't let them shoot those girls.  This is too much.  They got guns pointed at 'em!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The women are armed, Hal.  This is standard.  Now you stay calm here. These boys know what they're doin'.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm sorry to bother you, I know you're real busy right now, but how many times, Max?  How many times has that woman gotta be fucked over? You could lift one finger and save her ass and you won't even do that?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Get a hold of yourself!  You are way out of your jurisdiction, now come on!  Calm down!  Don't make me sorry I let you come!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Your name's Harlan?  I got an uncle named Harlan!

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: You do?  Is he a funny uncle? 'Cause if he is, then he and I got somethin' in common.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Oh shit.

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Stop.

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'm spinning.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I guess I'm startin' to feel a little better.

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: Yeah, you're startin' to feel pretty good to me, too.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Don't.  I'm married.  I don't feel good.  I've been sick.

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: It's okay.  I'm married, too.

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: You're beautiful.  It's okay.  I won't hurt you.  It's okay.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Stop it!  Goddamnit, I mean it! Louise is gonna wonder where I am. Let go!

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: Louise is alright.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Don't hurt me.  Harlan.  Please.

turns.speaker: HARLAN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: So J.D., what are you studying in school?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Human nature.  I'm majoring in behavioral science.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: So how come you don't have any kids?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Darryl, that's my husband, he says he's not ready.  He's still too much of a kid himself.  He prides himself on being infantile.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Did you get married real young?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Twenty-four isn't young.  I'd already been goin' out with him ten years when we got married.  I've never been with anybody but Darryl.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Well, if you don't mind me sayin' so, he sounds like a real asshole.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: It's okay.  He is an asshole.  Most of the time I just let it slide.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: This is J.D.  He's a student.  We're just givin' him a ride to... to here.  Louise said we could bring him here and then he'd have to go. And that's what he's doin'.  He's goin'.  Aren't you, J.D.?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Yup.  Thanks for the ride.  You all take care.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise, is that you?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Thelma?  It's me.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Well, I guess I'd better...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Wait...!  Um, where ya going?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I don't know.  Nowhere.  What are you doin'?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I don't know.  Nothin'.  Took a shower.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: That sounds nice.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, you wanna use the shower?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Oh.  I... where's Louise?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: She's off with Jimmy, that's her boyfriend.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: That's lonely for you, I guess.  I always think of motel rooms as lonely.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I am the great and powerful Oz...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: J.D.!  Just tell me.  I know you're not some schoolboy.  Now come on, nobody ever tells me shit.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I'm just some guy.  A guy whose parole officer is probably having a shit fit right about now.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What?!  Parole officer?  You mean you're a criminal?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Well, not anymore, Thelma, except for bustin' parole, I haven't done one wrong thing.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What did ya do?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I'm a robber.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're a bank robber?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Nope.  I've never robbed a bank.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Well, I robbed a gas station once, and I robbed a couple of liquor stores, and some convenience stores. And that's it.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Well, I was just down on my luck and it seemed like somethin' I was good at so I...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: No, I mean how would you do it?  Do you just sneak in real fast or hide out till the store closes or what?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Naw, honey, that would be burglary. I never got arrested for burglary. Burglary's for chicken shits.  If you're gonna rob someone, ya just have to go right on up to 'em and do it.  Just take the money.  That's robbery.  That's a whole 'nother deal.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Well, first you pick your place, see, then I'd just sit back and watch it for awhile.  Ya gotta wait for just the right moment, which is something you know instinctively, that can't be taught.  Then I'd waltz on in...

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I've always believed if done right, armed robbery doesn't have to be a totally unpleasant experience.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: God.  You're a real live outlaw!

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I may be the outlaw, but you're the one stealin' my heart.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: And smooth, boy, you are smooth.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're kinda the best thing that's happened to me in a long time.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: You're a little angle, you are.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Jimmy!  Hello, stranger.  What in the world are you doin' here?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Ask me no questions, I'll tell you no lies.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Good answer.  Same goes double for me.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Who's your friend?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Well, come on, gal, I got you a room.  You can go on in and take a nice cold shower.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Don't mind me, Jimmy, I'm just a wild woman.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I always knew that.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: A regular outlaw.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Louise!  Where are you?  Are you alright?  Honey...

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Hi.  I'm okay.  How are you?  Long time no see.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Louise, honey... Where are you?  You sound funny.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I am funny.  I'm real funny.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Are you in town?  This sounds long distance.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No, I'm out of town.  I'm in... I'm in real deep shit, Jimmy.  Deep shit Arkansas.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Louise, just tell me what the hell is going on here!  I come back, nobody knows where you are.  Is Thelma with you?  Darryl's been callin' here every half-hour sayin' he's gonna kill you both when you get back, he's goin' nuts.  I don't envy her if she is.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Where'd y'all go?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Fishing.  Look, Jimmy... I need you to help me.  This is serious.  I'm in trouble and I need you to help me.  Can you do that?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I have a savings account with about sixty-seven hundred dollars in it. Now I know you won't be able to get it out, but I'm good for it.  I need that money.  Can you wire me the sixty-seven hundred dollars and I'll pay you back?  Please, I'm desperate.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What the fuck is going on?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Something real bad has happened and I can't tell you what, just that it's bad and I did it and I can't undo it.  Can you help me?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Of course.  Of course!  Where?  Can't I bring it to you?  For God's sake, baby, please, just tell me what's happened, what could possibly be so bad?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Do you love me?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Christ, sure... yes!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Wire it to the Western Union in Oklahoma City,

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You're in Oklahoma?!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Louise, let me call you back after I wire it, so you'll know which office to go to.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Can't it go to any office?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No, for that much money I have to tell them exactly which office.  I know, I've had to have money wired to me on the road.  And there has to be a code word or they won't give it to you.  I'll have to tell you the code.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Tell me now.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Call me back.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Okay.  I'll call you back.  In an hour.  Don't tell Darryl.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I know.  Call me back.  Louise, I love you, okay?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Is that how you answer the phone?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I got it.  I was afraid I'd missed you.  I almost couldn't get a check cashed.  It's Saturday.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Who did it?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Friend of mine, owns a club.  Dickie Randall.  You'd know him if you saw him.  His brother was in your class. Terry.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You didn't say what it was for, did you?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No, honey.  I told him I was buyin' a car.  What is it for?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Good.  That was good.  Where do I go?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's a place called Shaw's Siesta Motel.  The address is 1921 North East 23.  It's under your name.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: And what's the mysterious code word?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Peaches.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: That's the code word.  I miss you, peaches.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hey, peaches.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh my God!  Jimmy!  You... Oh my God!  What are you doin' here?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Can we get another room?  Just put it on my credit card.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Hello...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Now, my little coconut, what seems to be the trouble here?  Tell Daddy everything.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Jimmy, my daddy's still alive and it kind of gives me the creeps when you do that...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Okay, okay, just tell me what's the trouble.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Okay, peaches, okay.  But can I ask you one thing?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Does it have something to do with another guy?  Are you in love with him?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's nothin' like that.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Then what?!  What, goddamnit, Louise!  Where the fuck are you going?  Are you just leaving for fucking ever?  What, did you fuckin' murder somebody or what?!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Stop it!  Stop it, Jimmy, or I'll leave right now.  I'm not kiddin'!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Alright, alright.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Can I just ask you one other thing?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Will you at least see how it fits?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Jimmy... it's beautiful!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You didn't see that one comin', did ya?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: So whaddya think.  I mean... I could... uh... get a job.  Of some kind.  I mean you've been tellin' me that for years, right?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Why now, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: 'Cause, Louise.  I don't want to lose you.  And for some reason I get the feelin' you're about to split. Permanently.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'm the one... I never made it work. I just... It's not that I don't love you.  It's not that.  I just never thought I'd be thirty-six years old and I never thought... I don't know what I thought.  What do you want, darlin'.  What do you want me to do.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't know.  It doesn't even matter anymore.  I just want you to be happy... It's not that I don't love you either.  But Jimmy, your timing couldn't be worse.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Are you just doin' this to punish me?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Believe me, the last thing I want is for you to get punished.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Don't worry darlin'.  I'll say I never found you.  I'll say anything you want.  We'll find a way to get you out of this, whatever it is.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Damn, Jimmy, did you take a pill that makes you say all the right stuff?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'm choking on it.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Hello, Officer.  Is there a problem?

turns.speaker: PATROLMAN
turns.text: You wanna let me see your license, please?

turns.speaker: PATROLMAN
turns.text: You wanna take it out of your wallet, please?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: PATROLMAN
turns.text: Is this your car?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PATROLMAN
turns.text: You wanna come with me, please? Walk around and get in the car, please.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: In the back?

turns.speaker: PATROLMAN
turns.text: Front.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Am I in trouble?

turns.speaker: PATROLMAN
turns.text: As far as I'm concerned, yes, ma'am, you are.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, wait now.  I still have to ask Darryl if I can go.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You mean you haven't asked him yet? For Christ sake, Thelma, is he your husband or your father?  It's just two days.  For God's sake, Thelma. Don't be a child.  Just tell him you're goin' with me, for cryin' out loud.  Tell him I'm havin' a nervous breakdown.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: He already thinks you're out of your mind, Louise, that don't carry much weight with Darryl.  Are you at work?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No, I'm callin' from the Playboy Mansion.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'll call you right back.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Not this weekend, sweetie, she's runnin' away with me.  Hi.  What'd he say?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What time are you gonna pick me up?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You're kiddin'!  Alright!  I'll be there around two or three.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What kind of stuff do I bring?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't know.  Warm stuff, I guess. It's the mountains.  I guess it gets cold at night.  I'm just gonna bring everything.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Okay.  I will, too.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: And steal Darryl's fishin' stuff.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I don't know how to fish, Louise.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Neither do I, Thelma, but Darryl does it, how hard can it be?  I'll see you later.  Be ready.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We don't need the lantern.  The place has electricity.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I wanna take it anyway.  Just in case.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: In case of what?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: In case there's some escaped psycho killer on the loose, who cuts the electricity off and tries to come in and kill us.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh yeah, sure, Thelma, that lantern will come in real handy.  Maybe we could tow your car behind, in case he steals the spark plugs.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: We'd have to.  That thing barely makes it down the driveway.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Whose place is this again?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's Bob's, the day manager's.  He's gettin' a divorce, so his wife's gettin' this place, so he's just lettin' all his friends use it till he has to turn over the keys.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I've never had the chance to go out of town without Darryl.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: How come he let you go?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: 'Cause I didn't ask him.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Aw, shit, Thelma, he's gonna kill you.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, he has never let me go.  He never lets me do one goddamn thing that's any fun.  All he wants me to do is hang around the house the whole time while he's out doing God only knows what.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: How much longer is it gonna be?  I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Another hour of so.  We've got enough food for a month.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'll never make it... Can't we stop just for a few minutes...

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We've not gonna get to the cabin till after dark as it is, Thelma.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Then what difference does it make if we stop?  Come on.  I never get to do stuff like this.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I haven't seen a place like this since I left Texas.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Isn't this fun?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Tell me somethin'.  Is this my vacation or isn't it?  I mean, God, you're as bad as Darryl.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I just haven't seen you like this in a while.  I'm used to seeing you more sedate.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, I've had it up to my ass with sedate!  You said you and me was gonna get outta town and, for once, just really let our hair down. Well, darlin,' look out 'cause my hair is comin' down!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Alright...  I changed my mind.  I'll have a margarita with and a shot of Cuervo on the side, please.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Jeez, Louise, that wasn't very nice.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Can't you tell when somebody's hittin' on you?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: So what if he was?  It's all your years of waitin' tables has made you jaded, that's all.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, just relax, will ya.  You're makin' me nervous.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: So, Jimmy still hasn't called yet?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Givin' him a taste of his own medicine.  Asshole.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Louise.  I know you're all upset.  It's just I'm so excited to be out of the house, I guess.  I wonder if Darryl's home yet.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I wonder if Jimmy's gotten back.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Why don't you tell him to just to get lost once and for all?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Why don't you ditch that loser husband of yours?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: In the meantime, you said we were gonna have some fun.  So let's have some!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma, I'm gonna hit the little girls' room, and then we gotta hit the road.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Ready when you are.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Get the car.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Jesus Christ!  Louise, you shot him.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Get the car!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Shit!  I... I, which way?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: West.  Left.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise.  Where are we going?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't know, Thelma!  I don't know! Just shut up a minute so I can think.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Shouldn't we go to the cops?  I mean, I think we should tell the police.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Tell them what?!  What, Thelma? What do you think we should tell them?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I don't know.  Just tell 'em what happened.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Which part?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: All of it.  That he tried to rape me.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Only about a hundred people saw you cheek to goddamn cheek with him all night, Thelma!  Who's gonna believe that?!  We just don't live in that kind of world.  Pull over!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We gotta be inconspicuous.  Do you know what that means?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It means you don't talk to anybody. You don't draw attention to yourself in any way.  Do you understand that?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We have to think this through.  We have to be smart.  Now is not the time to panic.  If we panic now, we're done for.  Nobody saw it. Nobody knows it was us.  We're still okay.  Now all we have to do is just figure out our next move.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Our next move?  I'll say one thing, Louise.  This is some vacation.  I sure am having a good time.  This is real fun.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: If you weren't so concerned with having a good time, we wouldn't be here right now.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Just what is that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It means shut up, Thelma.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: So this is all my fault, is it.
